title: HTTP-only server mode doesn't exit after SIGTERM graceful shutdown
description: Found during CHUNK-05: When running in HTTP-only mode, ShutdownManager completes cleanup and logs 'Shutdown complete' but doesn't call process.exit(0). The stdio transport has its own signal handler that exits, but HTTP-only mode relies solely on ShutdownManager which doesn't exit. Server hangs after graceful shutdown completes.

title: Test guide G2 documents fixed security gap - update documentation
description:
## Documentation Update Needed

**Discovered:** CHUNK-01 security testing (2026-01-23)

### Issue
The security test guide (docs/testing/agent-browser-mcp-security-test-guide.md) documents Test G2 as a security gap where /api/cancel returns 200 without authentication.

### Actual Finding
The cancel endpoint now correctly returns 401 Unauthorized when called without auth. The gap has been fixed.

### Location
- File: docs/testing/agent-browser-mcp-security-test-guide.md
- Section: Category G: Known Security Gaps - Test G2

### Fix Applied
src/api/router.ts lines 57-62 apply createAuthMiddleware() to all routes after /health, including /cancel.

### Action Needed
Update test guide to remove G2 from 'Known Security Gaps' or mark it as resolved.

title: MCP Reference Server Phase 1
description: Production-quality reference implementation of MCP server targeting 2025-11-25 spec. Includes JSON-RPC 2.0, dual transport (stdio + HTTP), OAuth 2.1 with PKCE, extensions framework, and OpenTelemetry observability. Full plan: docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md

title: Project scaffolding and SDK setup
description: Initialize npm project, TypeScript config, install @modelcontextprotocol/sdk and dependencies. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#project-structure

title: stdio transport implementation
description: Newline-delimited JSON framing, stdin/stdout/stderr handling, process lifecycle, SIGTERM/SIGINT handling, graceful shutdown. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#stdio-transport

title: Streamable HTTP transport with sessions
description: Single /mcp endpoint, POST for messages, session ID management, header validation (MCP-Protocol-Version, Origin). See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#streamable-http-transport

title: SSE stream with replay support
description: GET endpoint for server-initiated messages, event IDs for replay (SEP-1699), Last-Event-Id reconnection. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#get-request-sse-stream

title: Stateless HTTP mode
description: Configurable stateless mode for horizontal scaling. No session ID, no SSE. MCP_STATELESS_MODE env var. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#stateless-mode

title: Pagination support for list operations
description: Opaque cursor handling, 50 item default page size, nextCursor response field. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#pagination

title: Progress notifications with rate limiting
description: progressToken in request _meta, notifications/progress emission, 100ms throttle interval (MCP_PROGRESS_INTERVAL_MS). See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#progress-notifications

title: Protected Resource Metadata endpoint
description: Serve /.well-known/oauth-protected-resource (RFC 9728). Include resource, authorization_servers, scopes_supported. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#protected-resource-metadata-rfc-9728

title: PKCE implementation (verifier and challenge)
description: Code verifier generation (43-128 chars), S256 challenge computation, BASE64URL encoding. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#pkce-implementation

title: Authorization Code flow with Auth0
description: Authorization request construction, state parameter, token exchange, resource indicators (RFC 8707). Auth0 integration. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#authorization-code-flow-with-pkce

title: Token validation and refresh
description: Access token validation, secure storage, refresh token handling, expiration checks. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#token-management

title: JSON-RPC 2.0 message types and parsing
description: Implement Request, Response, Notification types. Message ID handling, JSON Schema 2020-12 support. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#json-rpc-20-foundation

title: Scope management and incremental consent
description: Scope validation, enforcement, 403 with required scope in WWW-Authenticate (SEP-835). See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#scope-management

title: Completions handler (completion/complete)
description: Auto-complete suggestions for arguments. ref structure, partial value matching, hasMore indicator. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#completions

title: Logging handler (logging/setLevel, notifications/message)
description: Log level management (RFC 5424), setLevel method, message notifications. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#logging

title: Extensions framework and negotiation
description: Extension capability negotiation during init, namespace/name format, experimental capabilities, settings handling. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#p3-extensions-framework

title: M2M OAuth extension (client credentials)
description: Machine-to-machine auth (SEP-1046), client credentials flow, token endpoint, no refresh tokens. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#m2m-oauth-extension-sep-1046

title: OpenTelemetry integration
description: NodeSDK setup, OTLP trace/metric exporters, service name config. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#opentelemetry-integration

title: Structured JSON logging with correlation
description: JSON format logs, traceId/spanId inclusion, log level filtering. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#structured-logging

title: Metrics collection (requests, latency, errors)
description: Counter/histogram metrics: mcp.requests.total, mcp.requests.duration, mcp.errors.total, mcp.sessions.active. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#metrics

title: Health check endpoints (/health, /ready)
description: Liveness and readiness checks, dependency status, proper HTTP status codes. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#health-endpoints

title: Debug mode (MCP_DEBUG)
description: Verbose logging, request/response dumping, performance timing. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#debug-mode

title: Lifecycle management (initialize/shutdown)
description: Implement initialization handshake, protocol version validation, pre-init rejection, operation phase, graceful shutdown. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#lifecycle-management

title: Environment variable configuration
description: Load config from env vars: MCP_PORT, MCP_HOST, MCP_TRANSPORT, MCP_STATELESS_MODE, timeouts, Auth0 settings. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#configuration-reference

title: Graceful shutdown with timeout
description: SIGTERM/SIGINT handling, stop accepting connections, wait for in-flight requests (MCP_SHUTDOWN_TIMEOUT_MS), cleanup. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#graceful-shutdown

title: Unit tests for protocol and tools
description: Unit tests for JSON-RPC parsing, PKCE, tool validation, error codes, capability negotiation. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#unit-tests

title: Integration tests for transports and OAuth
description: Full stdio/HTTP flow tests, SSE reconnection, OAuth authorization, tool execution E2E. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#integration-tests

title: MCP Inspector compatibility validation
description: Validate against official MCP Inspector, test all methods, verify capabilities, confirm error handling. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#mcp-inspector-compatibility

title: npm package configuration
description: package.json setup, exports, bin entry, README, .env.example. Prepare for npm publish. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#technology-stack

title: Capability negotiation
description: Server capability advertisement (tools, logging, completions, experimental). Client capability recognition. Enforcement logic. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#capability-negotiation

title: Tool registry and executor
description: Tool definition schema, registration, lookup, tools/list with pagination, tools/call with validation, listChanged notifications. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#tools-implementation

title: Calculator tool implementation
description: Basic arithmetic: add, subtract, multiply, divide. Input/output schemas, readOnlyHint, idempotentHint annotations. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#1-calculator-calculate

title: Dice Roller tool implementation
description: Parse dice notation (2d6, 1d20+5), generate random rolls, calculate total. readOnlyHint annotation. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#2-dice-roller-roll_dice

title: Fortune Teller tool with completions
description: Fortune categories (love, career, health, wealth, general), mood options, auto-complete support. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#3-fortune-teller-tell_fortune

title: Error handling with standard codes
description: JSON-RPC error codes (-32700 to -32603), tool execution errors (isError:true per SEP-1303), error response formatting. See docs/plans/mcp-reference-server-plan.md#error-handling

- Tool call is initiated (calculate tool)

- Response never completes

Workaround: Restart backend server before each browser session.

title: No rate limiting on endpoints - DoS/brute force vulnerability
description:
## Security Gap: No Rate Limiting

**Discovered:** CHUNK-01 security testing (2026-01-23)
**Test:** G1 - 100 rapid requests to /api/health

### Current Behavior
All 100 concurrent requests to /api/health returned HTTP 200 with no throttling.

### Expected Behavior  
After a threshold (e.g., 100 requests/minute), return HTTP 429 Too Many Requests.

### Security Impact
- Denial of Service (DoS) attacks
- Brute force attacks on auth endpoints
- Credential stuffing attacks

### Recommendation
Implement rate limiting middleware (express-rate-limit):
- Global: 100 req/min per IP
- Auth endpoints: 10 req/min per IP
- Health: Higher limit or exempt for load balancers

### References
- Test results: security-test-screenshots/CHUNK-01-results.md
- Test guide: docs/testing/agent-browser-mcp-security-test-guide.md (Test G1)

title: HTTP-only server mode does not exit after SIGTERM graceful shutdown
description:
Found during CHUNK-05: When running in HTTP-only mode (transport='http'), sending SIGTERM triggers graceful shutdown but the process never exits. The ShutdownManager completes cleanup and logs 'Shutdown complete' but doesn't call process.exit(0). The stdio transport has its own signal handler that calls process.exit(0), but HTTP-only mode relies solely on ShutdownManager which doesn't exit.

Root cause: src/server.ts ShutdownManager.performShutdown() doesn't call process.exit(0) after cleanup.

Fix options:
1. Add process.exit(0) call at end of performShutdown() in ShutdownManager
2. Have MCPServer call process.exit(0) after shutdown completes
3. Ensure HTTP transport closes all sockets so Node event loop ends naturally
close_reason: Already fixed - process.exit(0) is called in performShutdown() when exitProcess=true
